admin_templates.template: <xen:selectunit label="{$preparedOption.title}" name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}]" value="{xen:raw $preparedOption.option_value}" hint="{$preparedOption.hint}" size="10" multiple="true"> <xen:options source="$formatParams" /> <xen:explain>{xen:raw $preparedOption.explain}</xen:explain> <xen:html> <input type="hidden" name="{$listedFieldName}" value="{$preparedOption.option_id}" /> {xen:raw $editLink} </xen:html> </xen:selectunit>

<xen:foreach loop="$forums" value="$forum"> <xen:controlunit label="{$forum.title}"> <xen:html> {xen:phrase display_cutoff}: <xen:spinbox name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][{$forum.node_id}][cutoff]" value="{$forum.cutoff}" size="1" min="0" />           <input type="checkbox" name="{$fieldPrefix}[{$preparedOption.option_id}][{$forum.node_id}][topctrl]" value="1" {xen:if {$forum.topctrl}, 'checked="checked"'} /> {xen:phrase override_topctrl}
<input type="hidden" name="{$listedFieldName}" value="{$preparedOption.option_id}" /> {xen:raw $editLink} </xen:html> </xen:controlunit> </xen:foreach>
<xen:controlunit label=""> <xen:explain>{xen:raw $preparedOption.explain}</xen:explain> </xen:controlunit>

phrases.phrase:
[QUOTE][CENTER][SIZE=4]An administrator or the event organizer has deleted this event from the system.[/SIZE][/CENTER]
[CENTER][SIZE=6][B]This thread has now been automatically locked.[/B][/SIZE][/CENTER][/QUOTE]
Are you sure you wish to delete this event?
Are you sure you wish to delete these RSVPs?
If selected, users will be able to respond with their attendance.
This event has already begun, or has already passed; RSVP has been since closed.
This event is awaiting approval before it gets added to the calendar.
The organizer for this event has disabled the RSVP system; RSVP has been closed.
Do not include date/location info in the event title. It will be added automatically.
If enabled, when creating and editing events, clock times will be disabled in 24-hour mode (rather than 12-hour mode). You will still need to edit the time title format to match.

If disabled, past instances of recurring events will NOT be stored in the archive.
Disabling this may clean up the clutter on your calendar and event archive.
If a user has not been active in the past X months, they will not be listed for birthdays.
You can enable/disable the birthday counts on the monthly calendar.

Any event that ends before this hour will not be considered to be taking place on a specific day. For example, if you have an event that starts on Friday at 2 PM, and ends on Sunday at 2 AM, it will not be considered to be taking place on Sunday, since the end time is before 6 AM. (That is of course, assuming this option is set to 6).
Format of date in thread titles. Be sure to follows PHP's date() rules.
The default view mode when viewing the event calendar.

If enabled, users will be able to submit endless recurring events. These events will recur at
the specified intervals till the end of time. Otherwise, users will have to submit a stop date.

Display Cutoff is the number of days of events to show at the top of an event forum.
By default, users can create event threads and normal threads in an event forum. If Override Top Control is checked, users will be unable to create normal threads on that event forum.
Which forums should be classified for events?
If unchecked, form fields for address, city, state and zip code will be hidden. Without this information events will not have a location map. Basic venue information will still be required.
The URL specified here will be used to give information (such as a map) about a physical location. The URL must include a {location} token.
This is the maximum number of hours in which an event can be set.
This is the minimum number of hours in which an event can be set.
By default, users can only set events to the hour. If you enable this option, they will be permitted to set events down to 15-minute intervals.
How many months to process recurring events on the calendar
Format of thread titles. Use {date}, {location} and {event} to insert information.
Format of time in thread titles. Be sure to follows PHP's date() rules.
If you set a stop date, this event will stop repeating after that time.
Upcoming events for the next {days} day(s)
You can not RSVP for this event
